title: Mining giant BHP trumpets its ‘social value’ to investors
text:
BHP is talking up its “social value” in a bid to woo investors and reassure local communities that mining can be a force for good.

The world’s biggest miner by revenue is briefing investors in London this week about its new strategy, designed to ensure that all of its managers are reviewing their decisions to make sure they are having a positive impact on local communities – for example by hiring local workers or using local firms to supply goods.

The FTSE 100 company’s social value targets – first reported by the Telegraph in August – have been “embedded to its core”, and are also being used to set bosses’ pay, according to Geoff Healy, BHP’s head of external affairs.
